data.title: Delaware County NY Genealogy and History Site
data.meta_description: The Delaware County NY Genealogy and History Site is an attempt to gather in one place many of the public domain records for genealogical research in Delaware County, New York.

Bramley

The family of De Bromleigh was founded as early as [the] reigh of King John and for many years flourished in the counties of Stafford, Selof and Chester. Later, the name was spelled Bromleigh and in the reign of Queen Elizabeth it was Bramley. In 1566, Sir Thomas Bramley rose to hight advancement by the study of law. He was the recorder of the City of London and was constituted(?) Chancellor.

The following is translated from a slab in Westminster Abbey:

"Thomas Bromley remarkable for his wisdom, piety, and knowledge of law,

Privy Counsellor to Queen Elizabeth."

When William Bromley came to America in company with General Gage - he was a younger son of Sir Bromley Baronette but willing(?) to sever all his ties at home. He wrote his name Bramble. He enlisted in the Rev War in 1771 and reenlisted in 1778. He was engaged in the battle at Bemis Heights and wounded in the leg for which he received a pension from Oct 9, 1832 until time of his death in 1843.

The name is now written Bramley.
